Transaction_Country_Tax_Rule_Line_Data.description: Element containing Tax Rate Recoverabilities data for Tax Code.

validation.validation: Provide Tax Rates that match the Tax Code
Cannot select Recoverable Recoverabilities when using a Non-Taxable Applicability, [applicability]. [SUBJECT TO CHANGE]
Must select a Tax Option for each Tax Rate in the selected Tax Code
You can't enter a Tax Option for this type of transaction.
You must select a Tax Option of Calculate Self-Assessed Tax or Calculate Tax Due to Supplier for a Tax Rate.
Must select a Tax Recoverability for each Tax Rate in the selected Tax Code
You can't enter a Tax Recoverability for this type of transaction.
The tax option doesn't apply to a transaction tax rule for items when revenue is the tax rule type.
The tax recoverability doesn't apply to a transaction tax rule for items when revenue is the tax rule type.

Transaction_Tax_Rule_for_Country_Data.description: Transaction Country Tax Rule Line Data

validation.validation: Each Postal Code Range must have a Postal Code Range Start and Postal Code Range End defined.
Postal Code Range Start [start] must be alphanumerically less than Postal Code range End [end]
You must specify at least 1 tax attribute or item tax rule to create a tax rule for this country.
Specify a Transaction Country Tax Rule Line that belongs to the specified Transaction Tax Rule for Country.
You must include the reference ID for the Transaction Country Tax Rule Line before you can delete an existing Transaction Country Tax Rule Line.
Postal Code Range Start [PostalStart] - Postal Code Range End [PostalEnd] conflicts with an existing or another Postal Code Range defined for the same Country Region: [Region]

description: Transaction Tax Rule for Country Data

validation.validation: The values specified for Transaction Country Tax Rule are already in use for [country_tax_rule_name]. Select new values for Transaction Country Tax Rule.
The Country Tax Rule name is already in use.  Enter a new name.
You cannot change the Country once a Tax Rule for Country has been created.
You cannot change the VAT Group once a Tax Rule for Country has been created.
The Tax Rule Exception Group for a Country Tax Rule cannot be edited once the Country Tax Rule is created.
You can only select 1 Country Tax Rule that is not already in use for each Tax Rule Exception Group.  Enter a new rule.
validation.description: You can only select 1 Country Tax Rule that is not already in use for each Tax Rule Exception Group.  Enter a new rule.

validation.validation: You can only select 1 Country Tax Rule that is not already in use for each Tax Rule VAT Group.  Enter a new rule.
validation.description: You can only select 1 Country Tax Rule that is not already in use for each Tax Rule VAT Group.  Enter a new rule.

validation.validation: VAT Group must have the same Country as the Country Tax Rule
Company and Tax Status fields cannot be submitted for a Tax Rule for Country with a VAT Group
Tax Status fields cannot be submitted for a Tax Rule for Country with a Tax Rule Exception Group
Cannot specify both VAT Group and Tax Rule Exception Group for Country Tax Rule
Cannot have both a Customer Tax Status and a Supplier Tax Status.
Country Tax Rule must be of type Transaction Tax Rule for Country.
